page.title: 03PAST INDUSTRY
page.content: In the Guardbridge area there is evidence of industries created during the early 19th Century. For, example, there were meal, barley, lint, even a saw mill on the Motray Water. All were moved by water power. About this time, a large distillery was erected at Seggie, by Haigs, and was powered by steam. It was on this site that the Guardbridge Paper Company was set up in 1873, diverting the water supply for its own use; but thereby closing some of the mills. Brickmaking was important as a use for clay and there are ruins of at least 3 brickworks in Guardbridge. The Eden Estuary was used for salmon and sea-front fishing, but pollution has recently affected these badly. This has also happened to the Mussel industry. By the time the Paper Mill was in operation most other industries had declined.
